Package pwhldriver

Class Skater

java.lang.Object
pwhldriver.Player
pwhldriver.Skater
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Player>
public class Skater extends Player
A class to represent non-goalie position players. You must
  1. define private data members for the additional attributes that are specific to non-goalie players, essentially additional hitting statistics
  2. define a public constructor to take values for all the inherited and local data members, which sets their data members' values to the parameter values
  3. define public getters for the data members to be used in calculating aggregate statistics for the the team's hitting stats
  4. define a public toString method that produces a String in the format needed for the lookup method of Team 
    n is a position named name and has statistics
    PA: k  BB: m  SO: p  H: q  AB: r  BI: s  HR: t HBP: u BA: x  OBP: y
    which is discussed in the program assignment. The first 4 items come from the super class toString()
If you do extra credits, you may need to define more methods, but all data members must be private, so only object instances can directly access them.

  • Constructor Details

    • Skater

      public Skater(int num, String name, char pos, int gp, int goals, int assists, int pim, int pM, int pPG, int pPA, int shG, int shA, int foW, int numFO, int shots, int soG, int soA)
      A parameterized constructor of the Skater class that calls inherits from the Player abstract super class.
      Parameters:
      num - The Skater's number, passed to Player Super Class
      name - The Skater's name, passed to Player Super Class
      pos - The Skater's position, passed to Player Super Class
      gp - The Skater's amount of games played, passed to Player Super Class
      goals - The Skater's goals amount, passed to Player Super Class
      assists - The Skater's assists amount, passed to Player Super Class
      pim - The Skater's infraction minutes, passed to Player Super Class
      pM - How many times a player is on the ice when the team scores minus how many times they are on the ice when the opposing team scores
      pPG - The number of goals scored during a powerplay for their team
      pPA - The number of assists scored during a powerplay for their team
      shG - The number of goals scored during an opposing team's powerplay.
      shA - The number of assists scored during an opposing team's powerplay.
      foW - The number of faceoffs a player has won.
      numFO - The number of faceoffs a player participated in.
      shots - The number of shots a player has taken.
      soG - The number of goals scored during a shootout.
      soA - The number of assists scored during a shootout.

      Returns:

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Unit test for PositionPlayer - creates a PositionPlayer by calling the constructor and then prints it out. There is no need to comment this out! * Do NOT Change. Leave it at the bottom of the file!
